availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New Haven, New Haven County, Connecticut

body.p: I Lyman E Munson of the city & county of New Haven in the state of Connecticut appointed by the Governor of the state of Kentucky, a commissioner for the state of Kentucky to take the proof & acknowledgement of Deeds & other instruments &c & to administer oaths &c pursuant to the laws of said state of Kentucky do hereby solemnly swear that I will well & faithfully execute & perform all the duties of such commissioners under & by virtue of the laws of the state of Kentucky. In witness whereof I have hereto set my hand and official seal at the city & county of New Haven January 16- 1864

figure.ab:
LYMAN E. MUNSON
NOTARY PUBLIC & COMR OF DEEDS
NEW HAVEN, CT

body.p: Sworn & subscribed to in my presence in the city & county of New Haven January 18- 1864

figure.ab:
LYMAN E. MUNSON
NOTARY PUBLIC & COMR OF DEEDS
NEW HAVEN, CT

body.p:
Connecticut
Oath of
L. E. Munson
Comr Deeds
Redd 25th Jany/64
